content.question: If <math alttext="f of x, equals, open parenthesis, the cosine of, open parenthesis the square root of x, close parenthesis, minus, the natural log of, open parenthesis, x squared, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>ln</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, then <math alttext="f prime of x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="3 times, open parenthesis, the negative of the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 times the square root of x, end fraction, times the sine of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, close parenthesis, minus the fraction 2 over x, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
